Property.name: Restrictions
Property.val: Please refer to the cancer protocol cover page (www.cap.org/cancerprotocols) for information about which tumor types and procedures can be reported using this template.

Question.name: Q_380273
Question.title: ?Multiple Primary Sites (eg., stomach and small intestine)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_17302
DisplayedItem.title: Please complete a separate checklist for each primary site

ListItem.name: LI_19349
ListItem.title: Gastrointestinal stromal tumor, spindle cell type

DisplayedItem.name: DI_20747
DisplayedItem.title: The mitotic rate should be determined in 5 mm2 of tumor. With the use of older model microscopes, 50 HPF is equivalent to 5 mm2. Most modern microscopes with wider fields require approximately 20 to 25 HPF to encompass 5 mm2. If necessary, please measure a field of view to accurately determine actual number of fields required to be counted on individual microscopes to encompass 5 mm2.

ListItem.name: LI_52592
ListItem.title: G1, low grade (mitotic rate less than or equal to 5 per 5 mm2)

ListItem.name: LI_51361
ListItem.title: G2, high grade (mitotic rate greater than 5 per 5 mm2)

Question.name: Q_366831
Question.title: Distance from GIST to Closest Margin

ListItem.name: LI_55959
ListItem.title: Not applicable (no regional lymph nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_352576
ListItem.title: All regional lymph nodes negative for tumor

ListItem.name: LI_352577
ListItem.title: Tumor present in regional lymph node(s)

Question.name: Q_53901
Question.title: Number of Lymph Nodes with Tumor

DisplayedItem.name: DI_48356
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_48356_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

ListItem.name: LI_327832
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_19379
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor

ListItem.name: LI_19382
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm

ListItem.name: LI_19381
ListItem.title: pT3: Tumor more than 5 cm but not more than 10 cm

ListItem.name: LI_19383
ListItem.title: pT4: Tumor more than 10 cm in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_820558
ListItem.title: (m) Multiple primary synchronous tumors in a single organ

DisplayedItem.name: DI_51766
DisplayedItem.title: # When no lymph nodes are present (as is often the case with resection for GIST), the pathologic ‘N’ category is not assigned (pNX is not used for GIST) and should not be reported.

ListItem.name: LI_348258
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (no nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_348259
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_54554
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis

Question.title: ?pM Category (required only if confirmed pathologically) (Notes E, F)

ListItem.name: LI_19386
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_19386_1
Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_32044
DisplayedItem.title: The CAP GIST Biomarker Template can be used for reporting biomarkers requested.

Question.name: Q_43564
Question.title: Molecular Genetic Studies (eg., KIT, PDGFRA, SDHA / B / C / D, RAS, or NF1 mutational analysis or BRAF or FGFR1 fusion gene analysis)
